key_commands.description: List all pods in the namespace to confirm components (including text-service) are running.
List services and their ports to see the published port for text-service.
Check client service logs showing repeated 'Connection refused' to text-service:9090, indicating service reachability issues.
Verify text-service started successfully, narrowing issue to networking/mapping rather than app crash.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-social-network text-service-<POD_SUFFIX> -- sh -c 'ss -ltnp || netstat -tulpen'")
key_commands.description: Attempt to check listening ports inside the text-service container (tools missing), minor contribution.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl exec -n test-social-network text-service-585f7cbc5f-hx8sp -- sh -c 'ss -ltnp || netstat -tulpen'")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get endpoints -n test-social-network text-service -o yaml && kubectl get deploy -n test-social-network text-service -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Retrieve Endpoints and Deployment details; reveals Endpoints port is 9999 while containerPort is 9090, indicating a targetPort mismatch.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get endpoints -n test-social-network text-service -o yaml && kubectl get deploy -n test-social-network text-service -o yaml")

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get svc -n test-social-network text-service -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Inspect text-service definition; confirms Service targetPort is 9999 causing traffic to be forwarded to the wrong container port.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get svc -n test-social-network text-service -o yaml")
